text.text:
This is one of the hill parks in Singapore and part of the Singapore Southern Ridge . The park is popular with locals and tourists alike as it is a convenient access to the Henderson Wave, a popular tourist attraction where get to see the neighboring area at a high elevation. Further on from the Henderson Wave is  another tourist attraction - Mount Faber Park. At Mount Faber Park you can take the Cable Car to yet another tourist attraction - Sentosa Island. For those who prefers to walk, there is a trail leading to Vivocity, which is a bridge away from Sentosa.

You can also walk from Telok Blangah Hill Park to another tourist attraction - Hort Park .

originalText.text:

The park is popular with locals and tourists alike as it is a convenient access to the Henderson Wave, a popular tourist attraction where get to see the neighboring area at a high elevation. Further on from the Henderson Wave is  another tourist attraction - Mount Faber Park. At Mount Faber Park you can take the Cable Car to yet another tourist attraction - Sentosa Island. For those who prefers to walk, there is a trail leading to Vivocity, which is a bridge away from Sentosa.

You can also walk from Telok Blangah Hill Park to another tourist attraction - Hort Park .

text.text: Telok Blangah Hill Park is a park situated at Telok Blangah Green, off Henderson Road, in Bukit Merah. The most awesome features of this park are Henderson Waves Bridge linking it to Mount Faber Park and the Forest Walk which is a 1.3km elevated pedestrian bridge that enables you to walk among lush secondary forest canopy.

originalText.text: Telok Blangah Hill Park is a park situated at Telok Blangah Green, off Henderson Road, in Bukit Merah. The most awesome features of this park are Henderson Waves Bridge linking it to Mount Faber Park and the Forest Walk which is a 1.3km elevated pedestrian bridge that enables you to walk among lush secondary forest canopy.

text.text:
Visit the hill park during weekday evening.

Take grab and alight at car park, very easy to spot the the hill.

Attach photo do show that is not many people around during weekday.

Top of the hill really windy, nice place to relax to chit chat with your close one.

Disappointed that there is no "bed of flower" during the visit, maybe not the season or something else.

text.text:
Thank god this small hill range hemmed by high rises has been preserved. An oasis of greenery with a little bit of a climb makes this a must go if you want to do some shinrin-yoku (or forest bathing).

You have options of a rugged forest trail along the ground or a milder metallic trail along the treetops that’s good for children & seniors too. Gentle climbs and connectivity to Kent Ridge on one side and Henderson + MtFaber on the other allows you to stretch your hike if you feel like.

Deep greenery and cool breezes surprise you on every bend and if you keep an eye out you will see many more natural treasures

text.text:
28 Sep 2023: Oops! The entrance to Forest Walk is temporarily closed...expected completion is 30 Nov 2023.
12 Jul 2022: Cool breeze, scenic elevated walkway to Alexandra Arch and not forgetting the amazing “birds orchestra”
08 Jun 2022: Turn left or turn right? One will bring you to the elevated walkway of Forest Walk and Hort Park and the other will bring you to the iconic Henderson Waves and Mount Faber Park. Nice quiet environment...take a moment to listen to the birds singing or watch the squirrels in their natural surroundings.
